thread.title: Kenya: Obama Visit Forces NSE to Close Early
thread.title_full: Kenya: Obama Visit Forces NSE to Close Early

title: Kenya: Obama Visit Forces NSE to Close Early
text:
Somalia: African Forces Capture Al-Shabaab HQ 
"We wish to inform you that the Nairobi Securities Exchange (NSE) will today (Friday, July 24, 2015) vary its trading hours due to President Barack Obama's visit," the Exchange said in a statement. 
Trading usually open at 9:00am and close at 3:00pm during in any given trading week. No trades take place during weekends and public holidays. 
President Obama will be in Kenya for three days beginning today to attend the sixth Global Entrepreneurship Summit (GES). 
He will leave the country on July 26 for Ethiopia. Kenya is the first country in Sub-Sahara Africa to host the GES, a historic feat that will see President Obama becoming the first sitting US President visiting the country. 
He has previously by-passed Kenya on his visits to the continent. This will mark his fourth visit to the continent, the most of any sitting US President. Kenya 
US President Barack Obama has finally landed in Nairobi for the 6th Global Entrepreneurship Summit. see more » Copyright © 2015 The Nation. All rights reserved.
